entries.name: new(in_stream, out_stream, err_stream=STDERR, usetty=true)
entries.desc: Creates a new StreamUI wrapping in_stream for user input, out_stream for standard output, err_stream for error output.  If usetty is true then special operations (like asking for passwords) will use the TTY commands to disable character echo.

entries.name: alert(statement, question=nil)
entries.desc: Display an informational alert.  Will ask question if it is not nil.

entries.name: alert_error(statement, question=nil)
entries.desc: Display an error message in a location expected to get error messages. Will ask question if it is not nil.

entries.name: alert_warning(statement, question=nil)
entries.desc: Display a warning on stderr.  Will ask question if it is not nil.

entries.name: ask(question)
entries.desc: Ask a question.  Returns an answer if connected to a tty, nil otherwise.

entries.name: ask_for_password(question)
entries.desc: Ask for a password. Does not echo response to terminal.

entries.name: ask_yes_no(question, default=nil)
entries.desc: Ask a question.  Returns a true for yes, false for no.  If not connected to a tty, raises an exception if default is nil, otherwise returns default.

entries.name: backtrace(exception)
entries.desc: Prints a formatted backtrace to the errors stream if backtraces are enabled.

entries.name: choose_from_list(question, list)
entries.desc: Choose from a list of options.  question is a prompt displayed above the list.  list is a list of option strings.  Returns the pair [option_name, option_index].

entries.name: debug(statement)
entries.desc: Display a debug message on the same location as error messages.

entries.name: download_reporter(*args)
entries.desc: Return a download reporter object chosen from the current verbosity

entries.name: progress_reporter(*args)
entries.desc: Return a progress reporter object chosen from the current verbosity.

entries.name: terminate_interaction(status = 0)
entries.desc: Terminate the application with exit code status, running any exit handlers that might have been defined.

entries.name: tty?()
entries.desc: Returns true if TTY methods should be used on this StreamUI.
